long_desc.thetext:
Happens with MarkOccurrences enabled when putting the cursor on Guava 11.0 identifier 'ImprovedAbstractMap' in class StandardTable, line 503 which contains the text "private class Column extends Maps.ImprovedAbstractMap<R, V> {"

I have downloaded the Guava source code and tried this use case. I couldn't reproduce the behavior you were telling. Before I try reproducing further, can you tell if you had any errors in that file? Which version of Eclipse are you using?

I'm on 3.8M6.
No, there are no errors in that file. I added guava as a library to my project (from orbit).

I'm using 4.2 Juno and I'm getting a similar problem.
I'm not sure exactly what is prompting the error to happen, but it appears to have a similar outcome to the stacktrace mentioned prior to this comment.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2012-09-26 08:28:24.406 !MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Requesting Java AST from selection". !STACK 0 java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.DefaultBindingResolver.resolveType(DefaultBindingResolver.java:1542) at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.Type.resolveBinding(Type.java:181) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.search.ImplementOccurrencesFinder.initialize(ImplementOccurrencesFinder.java:114) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.JavaEditor.updateOccurrenceAnnotations(JavaEditor.java:3345) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.JavaEditor$6.selectionChanged(JavaEditor.java:3380) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.viewsupport.SelectionListenerWithASTManager$PartListenerGroup.calculateASTandInform(SelectionListenerWithASTManager.java:178) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.viewsupport.SelectionListenerWithASTManager$PartListenerGroup$3.run(SelectionListenerWithASTManager.java:155) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:54)

In the case where we have duplicate types, we throw an error and don't proceed to resolve the bindings for the hierarchy. Which is resulting in the NPE. We either have to guard the affect code with a null check or even better chuck out the null elements from the array.

(In reply to comment #6) > or even > better chuck out the null elements from the array.
Looks like were are already doing that and I was wrong that this would fix the issue. Since the resolvedBinding is going to be null only in the rejected cases, I think we can live with a null check. I will post a patch and see if I can add a test.

(In reply to comment #7) > Since the resolvedBinding is going to be null only in the > rejected cases, I think we can live with a null check. I will post a patch > and see if I can add a test.
And this is what we are doing in other case, such as SingleNameReference etc.

Created attachment 227601 Patch with test
The fix is just a null check and patch includes new test. Will release after running all tests.

All tests passed and fix's been released here:
http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=73c0b0b740cb64c7be657afbb9bc34e48a20047c
Verified for 4.3 M6 build id I20130310-2000
